meanings.definition: Tending to move toward one point or to approach each other
meanings.sent1: The two roads were convergent, leading to the same destination.
meanings.sent2: The convergent paths of the ants met at the food source.
meanings.sent3: The convergent ducks waddled together in a straight line.
meanings.sent4: Their thoughts were convergent, aligning perfectly on the same idea.
meanings.sent5: The convergent lines on the map showed the meeting point clearly.

meanings.sent1: The convergent streams merged into a single river.
meanings.sent2: The convergent flight paths of the birds crossed in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The convergent cars arrived at the intersection simultaneously.
meanings.sent4: Their interests were convergent, bringing them closer despite their differences.
meanings.sent5: The convergent winds created a whirlwind of leaves in the yard.

meanings.sent1: The convergent circles all intersected at the same point.
meanings.sent2: The convergent spokes of the wheel met at the hub.
meanings.sent3: The convergent planets orbited around the same star.
meanings.sent4: Their goals were convergent, focused on the shared objective.
meanings.sent5: The convergent lines of the spider's web formed a perfect center.
